title: Bug 7734: System can be shut down without savefile warnings
OB: When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file, shutting down Windows will cause the loss of the changes in the .txt file.
EB: There should be a warning or question message box to give users a chance to save their dirty model(s) before the computer is shut down/rebooted.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Start WSWB and create a new project.
2. Create a text file in the project and add a line of text to it.
3. Notice that the text file is marked as a dirty file.
4. Left click on the Windows Start menu.
5. Select the 'Shut Down' command to shutdown/reboot the computer.

Results:
- There is no warning or question message box displayed
- The computer is shut down/rebooted immediately

(Note: This issue may also affect other Windows programs like Word, Outlook, etc.)
